newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to tender for 3-yr, 180,000T sugar deal.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to tender for 3-yr, 180,000T sugar deal.

text.p: State-owned Taiwan Sugar Corp said on Wednesday it would hold an invitation-only tender in New York on October 23 for a contract to obtain 60,000 tonnes of sugar a year over three years.
The supply deal would start in January 1997, a Taiwan Sugar executive told Reuters by telephone.
The tender would be by invitation-only in New York city, he said, noting that the date would be October 23 in the United States but October 24 in Taiwan.
The state-owned monopoly is on track to import 120,000 tonnes of sugar in 1996, industry sources have said.
Taiwan Sugar bought two 30,000-tonne shipments of sugar on June 26 in New York at US$305.50 and US$302 per tonne on a cost-and-freight basis.
Traders said the company hoped to streamline its sugar procurement by landing one long-term contract rather than relying on smaller as-needed tenders.
Taiwan Sugar, like most other Taiwan state companies, is under mandate to privatise but the cabinet, in a June 27 ruling, determined it would not face serious competition before 2002.
